awd_abstract_narration: Single crystal x-ray crystallography coupled with a computer                    system is the most powerful analytical method for structure                     determination of solids.  In synthetic inorganic, organic,                      bioinorganic and organoetallic chemistry, single x-ray                          diffraction is an invaluable tool for characterizing molecular                  structure.  The information gained from the knowledge of the                    molecular composition and structure helps to develop new                        reactions of potentially general interest in catalysis or                       synthesis.                                                                                                                                                      This award from the Chemistry Research Instrumentation Program                  will help the Department of Chemistry at Texas Christian                        University acquire a complete single crystal x-ray                              diffractometer system with a computer.  Among the areas of                      chemical research that will be enhanced by the acquisition are                  the following:                                                                                                                                                  1.  Organosulfur Compounds:  Synthetic Metals, Complexes, and                       Metal Complex Hosts Systems                                                                                                                                 2.  Calixarenes as Enzyme Mimics                                                                                                                                3.  Mechanism, Scope, Limitations, and Applications of                              Phenol-Formaldehyde Reactions                                                                                                                               4.  New Inorganic Polymer Systems                                                                                                                               5.  Synthesis and Characterization of New Polyphoshazenes                                                                                                       6.  Biomimetic Catalysts                                                                                                                                        7.  Quantum-Confined Semiconductor Microelectrodes:  Surface                        Structure and Reactivity
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
